title: ‘Several injured’ and teenager arrested after stabbing at McDonald’s
text:
Greater Manchester Police said they believe several people may have been injured (Picture: MEN)

Several people are understood to have been injured in a stabbing at a McDonald’s in north Manchester this afternoon.

Police said a teenage boy was arrested after violence broke out in the restaurant in the Harpurhey Shopping Centre at around 2.35pm.

The boy was arrested on suspicion of section 18 assault.

A police spokesman said the incident is not being linked to terrorism.

The suspect is currently in custody and is due to be questioned by officers, Greater Manchester Police said.

Emergency services remain at the scene (Picture: PA)

A cordon remains in place around the McDonald’s and initial inquiries suggest several people have been injured, police said.

The North West Ambulance Service said a male was taken to hospital after being stabbed in the leg during the attack.

His age is not currently known.

No-one else was treated at the scene, the service said.

Pictures and video shared online showed several police cars and ambulances outside the restaurant while some customers filmed blood splattered across the floor.

One witness tweeted: ‘Just left Mcdonalds Harpurhey swarmed with police & now blue tape around the place.’

Police said their enquiries are ongoing.
